@graph.title: Thinking with Water
abstract: An exploration of the relationship between water's cultural meanings and urgent ecological issues.

Cover -- Title Page -- Copyright Page -- Table of Contents -- List of Poems and Credits -- Plates and Figures -- Acknowledgments -- Introduction: Toward a Hydrological Turn? -- Water Drawing (Version 1.0) (2010) -- Light, Sweet, Cold, Dark, Crude (LSCDC) a Cycle of Audiovisual Micro-Events (2006-ongoing) -- Generation, Generations at the Mouth -- Water and the Material Imagination: Reading the Sea of Memory against the Flows of Capital -- Water and Gestationality: What Flows beneath Ethics -- Subterranean Flows: Water Contamination and the Politics of Visibility after the Bhopal Disaster -- Water is Siwlkw -- Sounding a Sea-Change: Acoustic Ecology and Arctic Ocean Governance -- Frozen Refractions: Text and Image Projections on Ice (2010) -- Taste the ource (While Supplies Last) (2006-Present) -- Jellyfish Science, Jellyfish Aesthetics: Posthuman Reconfigurations of the Sensible -- Alsek Lake -- River-Adaptiveness in a Globalized World -- Conceptual Relations: Water, Ideologies, and Theoretical Subversions -- Erratics -- The Dammed of the Earth: Reading the Mega-Dam for the Political Unconscious of Globalization -- Untapping Watershed Mind -- Pond -- Footbridge at Atwater: A Chorographic Inventory of Effects -- Mapping Waters: Thinking with Watery Places -- Appendix of Place Names -- Works Referenced -- Contributors -- Index.
